intro: Morisonia imrayi, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in coastal areas with well-drained soil. Morisonia imrayi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
